label: Nucleic acids
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the processing and analysis of nucleic acid sequence, structural and other data.

label: Proteins
hasDefinition: Topic concerning archival, processing and analysis of protein data, typically molecular sequence and structural data.

label: Metabolites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the structures of reactants or products of metabolism, for example small molecules such as including vitamins, polyols, nucleotides and amino acids.
comment: This concept excludes macromolecules such as proteins and nucleic acids.

label: Sequence analysis
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, processing and analysis of molecular sequences (monomer composition of polymers) including molecular sequence data resources, sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.

label: Structure analysis
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the curation, processing and analysis of the structure of biological molecules, typically proteins and nucleic acids and other macromolecules.
comment: This includes related concepts such as structural properties, alignments and structural motifs.

label: Structure prediction
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the prediction of molecular (secondary or tertiary) structure.

label: Phylogeny
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms.
comment: This includes diverse phylogenetic methods, including phylogenetic tree construction, typically from molecular sequence or morphological data, methods that simulate DNA sequence evolution, a phylogenetic tree or the underlying data, or which estimate or use molecular clock and stratigraphic (age) data, methods for studying gene evolution etc.

label: Functional genomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of gene or protein functions and their interactions in totality in a given organism, tissue, cell etc.

label: Ontology and terminology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the conceptualisation, categorisation and nomenclature (naming) of entities or phenomena within biology or bioinformatics. This includes formal ontologies, controlled vocabularies, structured glossary, symbols and terminology or other related resource.

label: Data search, query and retrieval
comment: This includes, for example, search, query and retrieval of molecular sequences and associated data.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the search and query of data sources (typically biological databases or ontologies) in order to retrieve entries or other information.

label: Bioinformatics
comment: This includes data  processing in general, including basic handling of files and databases, datatypes, workflows and annotation.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, curation, processing and analysis of complex biological data.

label: Data visualisation
hasDefinition: Topic for the rendering (drawing on a computer screen) or visualisation of molecular sequences, structures or other biomolecular data.

label: Nucleic acid structure analysis
comment: Includes secondary and tertiary nucleic acid structural data, nucleic acid thermodynamic, thermal and conformational properties including DNA or DNA/RNA denaturation (melting) etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, curation, processing and analysis of nucleic acid structural information, such as whole structures, structural features and alignments, and associated annotation.

label: RNA
hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA sequences and structures.

label: Mapping
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the mapping of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences.
comment: This includes resources that aim to identify, map or analyse genetic markers in DNA sequences, for example to produce a genetic (linkage) map of a chromosome or genome or to analyse genetic linkage and synteny. It also includes resources for physical (sequence) maps of a DNA sequence showing the physical distance (base pairs) between features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes and other genetic markers.

label: Protein expression
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the translation of mRNA into protein and subsequent protein processing in the cell.

label: Gene structure
comment: This includes the study of promoters, coding regions etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, gene fusion, splice sites etc.

label: Proteomics
comment: Proteomics includes any methods (especially high-throughput) that separate, characterize and identify expressed proteins such as mass spectrometry, two-dimensional gel electrophoresis and protein microarrays, as well as in-silico methods that perform proteolytic or mass calculations on a protein sequence and other analyses of protein expression data, for example in different cells or tissues.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein and peptide identification, especially in the study of whole proteomes of organisms.

label: Structural genomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the elucidation of the three dimensional structure for all (available) proteins in a given organism.

label: Protein properties
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the physical and biochemical properties of peptides and proteins, for example the hydrophobic, hydrophilic and charge properties of a protein.

label: Protein interactions
comment: This includes experimental (e.g. yeast two-hybrid) and computational analysis techniques.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-protein, protein-DNA/RNA and protein-ligand interactions, including analysis of known interactions and prediction of putative interactions.

label: Protein folding, stability and design
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein stability, folding (in 3D space) and protein sequence-structure-function relationships.  This includes for example study of inter-atomic or inter-residue interactions in protein (3D) structures, the effect of mutation, and the design of proteins with specific properties, typically by designing changes (via site-directed mutagenesis) to an existing protein.

label: Mass spectrometry
hasDefinition: Topic concerning an analytical chemistry technique that measures the mass-to-charge ratio and abundance of irons in the gas phase.

label: Protein targeting and localization
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of how proteins are transported within and without the cell, including signal peptides, protein subcellular localization and export.

label: Carbohydrates
hasDefinition: Topic concerning carbohydrates, typically including structural information.

label: Lipids
hasDefinition: Topic concerning lipids and their structures.

label: Small molecules
comment: Small molecules include organic molecules, metal-organic compounds, small polypeptides, small polysaccharides and oligonucleotides.  Structural data is usually included.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning small molecules of biological significance, typically archival, curation, processing and analysis of structural information.

label: Sequence composition, complexity and repeats
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the archival, processing and analysis of the basic character composition of molecular sequences, for example character or word frequency, ambiguity, complexity, particularly regions of low complexity, and repeats or the repetitive nature of molecular sequences.

label: Sequence comparison
comment: The comparison might be on the basis of sequence, physico-chemical or some other properties of the sequences.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison of two or more molecular sequences, for example sequence alignment and clustering.

label: Sequence sites, features and motifs
hasDefinition:
Topic concerning the archival, detection, prediction and analysis of
positional features such as functional and other key sites, in molecular sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

label: Protein structural motifs and surfaces
comment: This includes conformation of conserved substructures, conserved geometry (spatial arrangement) of secondary structure or protein backbone, solvent-exposed surfaces, internal cavities, the analysis of shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches, role and functions etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning (3D) structural features or common 3D motifs within protein structures, including the surface of a protein structure, such as biological interfaces with other molecules.

label: Protein structure prediction
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the prediction, modelling, recognition or design of protein secondary or tertiary structure or other structural features.

label: Nucleic acid structure prediction
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the folding of nucleic acid molecules and the prediction or design of nucleic acid (typically RNA) sequences with specific conformations.

label: Molecular dynamics
comment: This includes resources concerning flexibility and motion in protein and other molecular structures.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study and simulation of molecular (typically protein) conformation using a computational model of physical forces and computer simulation.

label: Molecular docking
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the modelling the structure of proteins in complex with small molecules or other macromolecules.

label: Protein fold recognition
comment: For example threading, or the alignment of molecular sequences to structures, structural (3D) profiles or templates (representing a structure or structure alignment).
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the recognition (prediction and assignment) of known protein structural domains or folds in protein sequence(s).

label: Phylogenomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the integrated study of evolutionary relationships and whole genome data, for example, in the analysis of species trees, horizontal gene transfer and evolutionary reconstruction.

label: Sequence assembly
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the assembly of fragments of a DNA sequence to reconstruct the original sequence.
comment: This covers for example the alignment of sequences of (typically millions) of short reads to a reference genome.

label: Genetic variation
hasDefinition: Topic concerning stable, naturally occuring mutations in a nucleotide sequence including alleles, naturally occurring mutations such as single base nucleotide substitutions, deletions and insertions, RFLPs and other polymorphisms.

label: Pharmacology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of drugs and their effects or responses in living systems.

label: Gene expression
comment: Gene expression levels are analysed by identifying, quantifying or comparing mRNA transcripts, for example using microarrays, RNA-seq, northern blots, gene-indexed expression profiles etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the analysis of levels and patterns of synthesis of gene products (proteins and functional RNA) including interpretation in functional terms of gene expression data.

label: Gene regulation
hasDefinition: Topic concerning primarily the regulation of gene expression.

label: Pharmacogenomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the influence of genotype on drug response, for example by correlating gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.

label: Medicinal chemistry
comment: This includes methods that search compound collections, generate or analyse drug 3D conformations, identify drug targets with structural docking etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the design and chemical synthesis of bioactive molecules, for example drugs or potential drug compounds, for medicinal purposes.

label: Mice or rats
comment: The resource may be specific to a group of mice / rats or all mice / rats.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning mice or rats, e.g. information on a specific genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: Data mining
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the analysis of the biomedical and informatics literature.

label: Data deposition, annotation and curation
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the organisation and maintenance of a collection of biological database entries (or other such entities) including the annotation of entries, typically with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: File management
hasDefinition: Topic concerning basic manipulations of files or reports of generic biological data.
comment: This includes editing, reformatting, conversion, transformation, validation, debugging, indexing and so on.

label: NMR
hasNarrowSynonym: Rotational Frame Nuclear Overhauser Effect Spectroscopy
hasDefinition: Topic concerning an analytical technique that exploits the magenetic properties of certain atomic nuclei to provide information on the structure, dynamics, reaction state and chemical environment of molecules.

label: Sequence classification
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the classification of molecular sequences based on some measure of their similarity.
comment: Methods including sequence motifs, profile and other diagnostic elements which (typically) represent conserved patterns (of residues or properties) in molecular sequences.

label: Protein modifications
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein chemical modifications, e.g. post-translational modifications.
comment: EDAM does not describe all possible protein modifications. For fine-grained annotation of protein modification use the Gene Ontology (children of concept GO:0006464) and/or the Protein Modifications ontology (children of concept MOD:00000)

label: Molecular interactions, pathways and networks
hasDefinition: Topic concerning molecular interactions, biological pathways, networks and other models.

label: Laboratory information management
hasDefinition: Topic concerning laboratory management and resources, for example, catalogues of biological resources for use in the lab including cell lines, viruses, plasmids, phages, DNA probes and primers and so on.

label: Ecology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the ecological and environmental sciences and especially the application of information technology (ecoinformatics).

label: Electron microscopy
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter by studying the interference pattern from firing electrons at a sample, to analyse structures at resolutions higher than can be achieved using light.

label: Peptides and amino acids
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the physicochemical, biochemical or structural properties of amino acids or peptides.

label: Drugs and target structures
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the structures of drugs, drug target, their interactions and binding affinities.

label: Model organisms
comment: This may include information on the genome (including molecular sequences and map, genes and annotation), proteome, as well as more general information about an organism.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning a specific organism, or group of organisms, used to study a particular aspect of biology.

label: Genomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning whole genomes of one or more organisms, or genomes in general, such as meta-information on genomes, genome projects, gene names etc.

label: Gene families
hasDefinition: Topic concerning particular gene(s), gene family or other gene group or system and their encoded proteins.

label: Chromosomes
hasDefinition: Topic concerning chromosomes.

label: Genotype and phenotype
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of genetic constitution of a living entity, such as an individual, and organism, a cell and so on, typically with respect to a particular observable phenotypic traits, or resources concerning such traits, which might be an aspect of biochemistry, physiology, morphology, anatomy, development and so on.

label: Sequence design
comment: This includes the design of primers for PCR and DNA amplification or the design of molecular probes.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning molecular probes (e.g. a peptide probe or DNA microarray probe) or primers (e.g. for PCR).

label: Pathology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning diseases, including diseases in general and the genes, gene variations and proteins involved in one or more specific diseases.

label: Taxonomy
hasDefinition: Topic concerning organism classification, identification and naming.

label: DNA
hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA sequences and structure, including processes such as methylation and replication.
comment: The DNA sequences might be coding or non-coding sequences.

label: Coding RNA
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-coding regions including coding sequences (CDS), exons, translation initiation sites and open reading frames
comment: This includes expressed sequence tag (EST) or complementary DNA (cDNA) sequences.

label: Functional, regulatory and non-coding RNA
comment: Non-coding RNA includes  piwi-interacting RNA (piRNA), small nuclear RNA (snRNA) and small nucleolar RNA (snoRNA).  Regulatory RNA includes microRNA (miRNA) - short single stranded RNA molecules that regulate gene expression, and small interfering RNA (siRNA).
hasDefinition: Topic concerning non-coding or functional RNA sequences, including regulatory RNA sequences, ribosomal RNA (rRNA) and transfer RNA (tRNA).

label: Protein families
hasDefinition: Topic concerning primarily the classification of proteins (from sequence or structural data) into clusters, groups, families etc., curation of a particular protein or protein family, or any other proteins that have been classified as members of a common group.
comment: A protein families database might include the classifier (e.g. a sequence profile) used to build the classification.

label: Protein domains and folds
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein tertiary structural domains and folds.

label: Transcription factors and regulatory sites
comment: Transcription factor proteins either promote (as an activator) or block (as a repressor) the binding to DNA of RNA polymerase.  Regulatory sites including transcription factor binding site as well as promoters, enhancers, silencers and boundary elements / insulators.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning proteins that bind to DNA and control transcription of DNA to mRNA (transcription factors) and also transcriptional regulatory sites, elements and regions (such as promoters, enhancers, silencers and boundary elements / insulators) in nucleotide sequences.

label: Metabolic pathways
hasDefinition: Topic concerning metabolic pathways.

label: Signaling pathways
hasDefinition: Topic concerning signaling pathways.

label: Plants
comment: The resource may be specific to a plant, a group of plants or all plants.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning plants, e.g. information on a specific plant genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: Viruses
hasDefinition: Topic concerning viruses, e.g. sequence and structural data, interactions of viral proteins, or a viral genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
comment: The resource may be specific to a virus, a group of viruses or all viruses.

label: Fungi
hasDefinition: Topic concerning fungi and molds, e.g. information on a specific fungal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
comment: The resource may be specific to a fungus, a group of fungi or all fungi.

label: Pathogens
comment: The resource may be specific to a pathogen, a group of pathogens or all pathogens.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning pathogens, e.g. information on a specific vertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: Comparative genomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study (typically comparison) of the sequence, structure or function of multiple genomes.

label: Mobile genetic elements
hasDefinition: Topic concerning mobile genetic elements, such as transposons, Plasmids, Bacteriophage elements and Group II introns.

label: Immunology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of information technology to immunology such as immunological processes, immunological genes, proteins and peptide ligands, antigens and so on.

label: Membrane and  lipoproteins
hasDefinition: Topic concerning lipoproteins (protein-lipid assemblies), and proteins or region of a protein that spans or are associated with a membrane.

label: Enzymes
hasDefinition: Topic concerning proteins that catalyze chemical reaction, the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reactions, enzyme nomenclature etc.

label: Primers
hasDefinition: Topic concerning PCR primers and hybridization oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.

label: PolyA signal or sites
comment: A polyA signal is required for endonuclease cleavage of an RNA transcript that is followed by polyadenylation. A polyA site is a site on an RNA transcript to which adenine residues will be added during post-transcriptional polyadenylation.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning regions or sites in a eukaryotic and eukaryotic viral RNA sequence which directs endonuclease cleavage or polyadenylation of an RNA transcript.

label: CpG island and isochores
hasExactSynonym: Nucleic acid features (CpG island and isochore)
hasDefinition: Topic concerning CpG rich regions (isochores) in a nucleotide sequence.

label: Restriction sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning restriction enzyme recognition sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.

label: Splice sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning splice sites in a nucleotide sequence or alternative RNA splicing events.

label: Matrix/scaffold attachment sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning matrix/scaffold attachment regions (MARs/SARs) in a DNA sequence.

label: Operon
hasDefinition: Topic concerning operons (operators, promoters and genes) from a bacterial genome.
comment: The report for a query sequence or gene might include the predicted operon leader and trailer gene, gene composition of the operon and associated information, as well as information on the query.

label: Promoters
hasDefinition: Topic concerning whole promoters or promoter elements (transcription start sites, RNA polymerase binding site, transcription factor binding sites, promoter enhancers etc) in a DNA sequence.

label: Structural biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the molecular structure of biological molecules, particularly macromolecules such as proteins and nucleic acids.
comment: This includes experimental methods for biomolecular structure determination, such as X-ray crystallography, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy, microscopy etc., including the assignment or modelling of molecular structure from such data.
consider: This includes Informatics concerning data generated from the use of microscopes, including optical, electron and scanning probe microscopy.  Includes methods for digitizing microscope images and viewing the produced virtual slides and associated data on a computer screen.

label: Protein membrane regions
comment: This might include the location and size of the membrane spanning segments and intervening loop regions, transmembrane region IN/OUT orientation relative to the membrane, plus the following data for each amino acid: A Z-coordinate (the distance to the membrane center), the free energy of membrane insertion (calculated in a sliding window over the sequence) and a reliability score. The z-coordinate implies information about re-entrant helices, interfacial helices, the tilt of a transmembrane helix and loop lengths.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning trans- or intra-membrane regions of a protein, typically describing physicochemical properties of the secondary structure elements.

label: Structure comparison
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the comparison of two or more molecular structures, for example structure alignment and clustering.
comment: This might involve comparison of secondary or tertiary (3D) structural information.

label: Function analysis
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of gene and protein function including the prediction of functional properties of a protein.

label: Prokaryotes and archae
comment: The resource may be specific to a prokaryote, a group of prokaryotes or all prokaryotes.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning specific bacteria or archaea, e.g. information on a specific prokaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: Cell biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning cells, such as key genes and proteins involved in the cell cycle.

label: Cheminformatics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of information technology to chemistry in biological research environment.

label: Systems biology
comment: This includes databases of models and methods to construct or analyse a model.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the holistic modelling and analysis of complex biological systems and the interactions therein.

label: Statistics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of statistical methods to biological problems.

label: Molecular modelling
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the construction, analysis, evaluation, refinement etc. of models of a molecules properties or behaviour.

label: SNP
comment: A SNP is a DNA sequence variation where a single nucleotide differs between members of a species or paired chromosomes in an individual.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNP) and associated data, for example, the discovery and annotation of SNPs.

label: Exons
hasDefinition: Topic concerning exons in a nucleotide sequences.

label: Gene transcription features
comment: This includes promoters, CAAT signals, TATA signals, -35 signals, -10 signals, GC signals, primer binding sites for initiation of transcription or reverse transcription, enhancer, attenuator, terminators and ribosome binding sites.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning transcription of DNA into RNA including the regulation of transcription.

label: DNA mutation
hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA mutation.

label: Oncology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of cancer, for example, genes and proteins implicated in cancer.

label: Toxins and targets
hasDefinition: Topic concerning structural and associated data for toxic chemical substances.

label: Introns
hasDefinition: Topic concerning introns in a nucleotide sequences.

label: Protein structure analysis
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein secondary or tertiary structural data and/or associated annotation.

label: Humans
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the human genome, including molecular sequences, genes, annotation, maps and viewers, the human proteome or human beings in general.

label: Eukaryotes
hasDefinition: Topic concerning eukaryotes or data concerning eukaryotes, e.g. information on a specific eukaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
comment: The resource may be specific to a eukaryote, a group of eukaryotes or all eukaryotes.

label: Invertebrates
comment: The resource may be specific to an invertebrate, a group of invertebrates or all invertebrates.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning invertebrates, e.g. information on a specific invertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: Vertebrates
comment: The resource may be specific to a vertebrate, a group of vertebrates or all vertebrates.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning vertebrates, e.g. information on a specific vertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: Unicellular eukaryotes
comment: The resource may be specific to a unicellular eukaryote, a group of unicellular eukaryotes or all unicellular eukaryotes.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning unicellular eukaryotes, e.g. information on a unicellular eukaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: X-ray diffraction
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter and their structure by means of the diffraction of X-rays, typically the diffraction pattern caused by the regularly spaced atoms of a crystalline sample.

label: Immunoproteins, genes and antigens
hasDefinition: Topic concerning immunity-related genes, proteins and their ligands.
comment: This includes T cell receptors (TR), major histocompatibility complex (MHC), immunoglobulin superfamily (IgSF) / antibodies, major histocompatibility complex superfamily (MhcSF), etc."

label: Toxicology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning toxins and the adverse effects of these chemical substances on living organisms.

label: Gene regulatory networks
hasDefinition: Topic concerning gene regulatory networks.

label: VNTR
comment: VNTRs occur in non-coding regions of DNA and consists sub-sequence that is repeated a multiple (and varied) number of times.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning variable number of tandem repeat (VNTR) polymorphism in a DNA sequence.

label: Microsatellites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning microsatellite polymorphism in a DNA sequence.
comment: A microsatellite polymorphism is a very short subsequence that is repeated a variable number of times between individuals. These repeats consist of the nucleotides cytosine and adenosine.

label: RFLP
hasDefinition: Topic concerning restriction fragment length polymorphisms (RFLP) in a DNA sequence.
comment: An RFLP is defined by the presence or absence of a specific restriction site of a bacterial restriction enzyme.

label: DNA polymorphism
hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA polymorphism.

label: Molecular biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the molecular basis of biological activity, particularly the macromolecules (e.g. proteins and nucleic acids) that are essential to life.

label: Biodiversity
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the degree of variation of life forms within a given ecosystem, biome or an entire planet.

label: Genetics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of genes, genetic variation and heredity in living organisms.

label: Quantitative genetics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the genes and genetic mechanisms such as Mendelian inheritance that underly continuous phenotypic traits (such as height or weight).

label: Population genetics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the distribution of allele frequencies in a population of organisms and its change subject to evolutionary processes including natural selection, genetic drift, mutation and gene flow.

label: Documentation and help
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the documentation of resources such as tools, services and databases and how to get help.

label: Medical informatics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of information technology to health, disease and biomedicine.

label: Developmental biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning how organisms grow and develop.

label: Embryology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the development of organisms between the one-cell stage (typically the zygote) and the end of the embryonic stage.

label: Anatomy
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the form and function of the structures of living organisms.

label: Literature and reference
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the scientific literature, reference information and documentation.

label: Biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning a particular biological science, especially observable traits such as aspects of biochemistry, physiology, morphology, anatomy, development and so on.

label: Data management
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the general handling of data stored in digital archives such as databanks, databases proper, web portals and other data resources.

label: Protein topological domains
hasDefinition: Topic concerning topological domains such as cytoplasmic regions in a protein.

label: Protein variants
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein sequence variants produced e.g. from alternative splicing, alternative promoter usage, alternative initiation and ribosomal frameshifting.

label: Expression signals
hasDefinition: Topic concerning regions within a nucleic acid sequence containing a signal that alters a biological function.

label: DNA binding sites
comment: This includes ribosome binding sites (Shine-Dalgarno sequence in prokaryotes).
hasDefinition: Topic concerning nucleic acids binding to some other molecule.

label: Nucleic acid repeats
comment: This includes long terminal repeats (LTRs); sequences (typically retroviral) directly repeated at  both ends of a defined sequence and other types of repeating unit.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning repetitive elements within a nucleic acid sequence.

label: DNA replication and recombination
comment: This includes binding sites for initiation of replication (origin of replication), regions where transfer is initiated during the conjugation or mobilization (origin of transfer), starting sites for DNA duplication (origin of replication) and regions which are eliminated through any of kind of recombination.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA replication or recombination.

label: Signal or transit peptide
hasDefinition: Topic concerning coding sequences for a signal or transit peptide.
hasExactSynonym: Nucleic acid features (signal or transit peptide)
comment: A signal peptide coding sequence encodes an N-terminal domain of a secreted protein, which is involved in attaching the polypeptide to a membrane leader sequence. A transit peptide coding sequence encodes an N-terminal domain of a nuclear-encoded organellar protein; which is involved in import of the protein into the organelle.

label: Sequence tagged sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning sequence tagged sites (STS) in nucleic acid sequences.
comment: Sequence tagged sites are short DNA sequences that are unique within a genome and serve as a mapping landmark, detectable by PCR they allow a genome to be mapped via an ordering of STSs.

label: Sequencing
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the determination of complete (typically nucleotide) sequences, including those of genomes (full genome sequencing, de novo sequencing and resequencing), amplicons and transcriptomes.

label: Metabolomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the systematic study of metabolites, the chemical processes they are involved, and the chemical fingerprints of specific cellular processes in a whole cell, tissue, organ or organism.

label: Epigenomics
comment: Epigenetics concerns the heritable changes in gene expression owing to mechanisms other than DNA sequence variation.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the epigenetic modifications of a whole cell, tissue, organism etc.

label: Metagenomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of genetic material recovered from environmental samples, and associated environmental data.

label: Structural variation
hasDefinition: Topic concerning variation in chromosome structure including microscopic and submicroscopic types of variation such as deletions, duplications, copy-number variants, insertions, inversions and translocations.

label: DNA packaging
hasDefinition: Topic concerning DNA-histone complexes (chromatin), organisation of chromatin into nucleosomes and packaging into higher-order structures.

label: Data security
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the protection of data, for example, patient health data.

label: Sample collections
hasDefinition: Topic concerning biological samples and specimens.

label: Biochemistry
hasDefinition: Topic concerning chemical substances and physico-chemical processes and that occur within living organisms.

label: Phylogenetics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of evolutionary relationships amongst organisms from analysis of genetic information (typically gene or protein sequences).

label: Epigenetics
comment: This includes sub-topics such as histone modification and DNA methylation.

label: Biotechnology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the exploitation of biological process, structure and function for industrial purposes, for example the genetic manipulation of microorganisms for the antibody production.

label: Phenomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning phenomes, or the study of the change in phenotype (the physical and biochemical traits of organisms) in response to genetic and environmental factors.

label: Evolutionary biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the evolutionary processes, from the genetic to environmental scale, that produced life in all its diversity.

label: Physiology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the functions of living organisms and their constituent parts.

label: Microbiology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the biology of microorganisms.

label: Parasitology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the anatomy, functions and disorders of the nervous system.

label: Medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning research in support of healing by diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease.

label: Neurobiology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the nervous system and brain; its anatomy, physiology and function.

label: Public health and epidemiology
hasAlternativeId: Topic concerning the the patterns, cause, and effect of disease within populations.

label: Biophysics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of physics to study biological system.

label: Computational biology
comment: This includes the modeling and treatment of biological processes and systems in mathematical terms (theoretical biology).
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the development and application of theory, analytical methods, mathematical models and computational simulation of biological systems.

label: Transcriptomics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the analysis of transcriptomes, or a set of all the RNA molecules in a specific cell, tissue etc.

label: Chemistry
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the composition and properties of matter, reactions, and the use of reactions to create new substances.

label: Mathematics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the is the study of numbers (quantity) and other topics including structure, space, and change.

label: Computer science
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the theory and practical use of computer systems.

label: Physics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter, space and time, and related concepts such as energy and force.

label: RNA splicing
hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA splicing; post-transcription RNA modification involving the removal of introns and joining of exons.
comment: This includes the study of splice sites, splicing patterns, splice alternatives or variants, isoforms, etc.

label: Molecular genetics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the structure and function of genes at a molecular level.

label: Respiratory medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of respiratory system.

label: Infectious disease
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis and management of transmissable disease with clinically evident illness resulting from infection with pathogenic biological agents (viruses, bacteria, fungi, protozoa, parasites and prions).

label: Rare diseases
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of rare diseases.

label: Computational chemistry
hasDbXref: Topic concerning the development and application of theory, analytical methods, mathematical models and computational simulation of chemical systems.

label: Neurology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the anatomy, functions and disorders of the nervous system.

label: Cardiology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the diseases and abnormalities of the heart and circulatory system.

label: Drug discovery
comment: This includes methods that search compound collections, generate or analyse drug 3D conformations, identify drug targets with structural docking etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the discovery and design of drugs or potential drug compounds.

label: Biobank
hasDefinition: Topic concerning repositories of biological samples, typically human, for basic biological and clinical research.

label: Mouse clinic
hasDefinition: Topic concerning laboratory study of mice, for example, phenotyping, and mutagenesis of mouse cell lines.

label: Microbial collection
hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of microbial cells including bacteria, yeasts and moulds.

label: Cell culture collection
hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of cells grown under laboratory conditions, specifically, cells from multi-cellular eukaryotes and especially animal cells.

label: Clone library
hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of DNA, including both collections of cloned molecules, and populations of micro-organisms that store and propagate cloned DNA.

label: Translational medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning 'translating' the output of basic and biomedical research into better diagnostic tools, medicines, medical procedures, policies and advice.

label: Compound libraries and screening
hasDefinition: Topic concerning collections of chemicals, typically for use in high-throughput screening experiments.

label: Biomedical science
hasExactSynonym: Topic concerning biological science that is (typically) performed in the context of medicine.

label: Data identity and mapping
hasExactSynonym: Topic concerning the identity of biological data and the mapping of entities in different databases.

label: Sequence search
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the search and retrieval from a database on the basis of molecular sequence similarity.

label: Biomarkers
hasDefinition: Topic concerning objective indicators of biological state often used to assess health, and determinate treatment.

label: Laboratory techniques
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the procedures used to conduct an experiment.

label: Data analysis
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process of systematically applying statistical and / or logical techniques to describe and illustrate, condense and recap, and evaluate data.

label: Data integration
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the combination of data from different sources to provide users with a unified view of these data.

label: Biomaterials
hasDefinition: Topic concerning any matter, surface or construct that interacts with a biological system.

label: Chemical biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of synthetic chemistry to study and manipulate biological systems.

label: Analytical chemistry
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the separation, identification, and quantification of the chemical components of natural and artificial materials.

label: Synthetic chemistry
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of chemistry to create new compounds.

label: Computer programming
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process that leads from an original formulation of a computing problem to executable programs.

label: Drug development
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process of bringing a new drug to market once a lead compounds has been identified through drug discovery.

label: Drug formulation and delivery
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the process of formulating abd administering a pharmaceutical compound to achieve a therapeutic effect.

label: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of how a drug interacts with the body.

label: Medicine research and development
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the discovery, development and approval of medicines.

label: Safety sciences
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the safety (or lack) of drugs and other medical interventions.

label: Pharmacovigilence
comment: Pharmacovigilence concerns safety once a drug has gone to market.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the detection, assesment, understanding and prevention of adverse effects of medicines.

label: Preclinical and clinical studies
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the testing of new medicines, vaccines or procedures on animals (preclinical) and humans (clinical) prior to their approval by regulatory authorities.

label: Imaging
comment: This includes diffraction experiments that are based upon the interference of waves, typically electromagnetic waves such as  X-rays or visible light, by some object being studied, typical in order to produce an image of the object or determine its structure.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the visual representation of an object.

label: Biological imaging
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of imaging techniques to understand biology.

label: Medical imaging
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of imaging techniques for clinical purposes for medical research.

label: Light microscopy
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of optical instruments to magnify the image of an object.

label: Laboratory animal science
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of animals and alternatives in experimental research.

label: Marine biology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of organisms in the ocean or brackish waters.

label: Molecular medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the identification of molecular and genetic causes of disease and the development of interventions to correct them.

label: Nutritional science
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the effects of food components on the metabolism, health, performance and disease resistance of humans and animals.  It also includes the study of human behaviours related to food choices.

label: Omics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the collective characterisation and quantification of pools of biological molecules that translate into the structure, function, and dynamics of an organism or organisms.

label: Quality affairs
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the processes that need to be in place to ensure the quality of products for human or animal use.

label: Regulatory affairs
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the protection of public health by controlling the safety and efficacy of products in areas including pharmaceuticals, veterinary medicine, medical devices, pesticides, agrochemicals, cosmetics, and complementary medicines.

label: Regnerative medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning biomedical approaches to clinical interventions that involve the use of stem cells.

label: Systems medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning an interdisciplinary field of study that looks at the dynamic systems of the human body as part of an integrted whole, incoporating biochemical, physiological, and environmental interactions that sustain life.

label: Veterinary medicine
hasAlternativeId: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disease, disorder and injury in animals.

label: Bioengineering
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the application of biological concepts and methods to the analytical and synthetic methodologies of engineering.

label: Geriatric medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine dealing with the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease in older people, and the problems specific to aging.

label: Allergy, clinical immunology and immunotherapeutics.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning health issues related to the immune system and their prevention, diagnosis and mangement.

label: Pain medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning with the prevention of pain and the evaluation, treatment and rehabilitation of persons in pain.

label: Anaesthesiology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning anaesthesia and anaesthetics.

label: Critical care medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the multidisciplinary that cares for patients with acute, life-threatening illness or injury.

label: Dermatology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with prevention, diagnosis and treatment of disorders of the skin, scalp, hair and nails.

label: Dentistry
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study, diagnosis, prevention and treatments of disorders of the oral cavity, maxillofacial area and adjacent structures.

label: Ear, nose and throat medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the ear, nose and throat.

label: Endocrinology and metabolism
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine dealing with diseases of endocrine organs, hormone systems, their target organs, and disorders of the pathways of glucose and lipid metabolism.

label: Haematology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the blood, blood-forming organs and blood diseases.

label: Gastroenterology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the oesophagus, stomach, duodenum, jejenum, ileum, large intestine, sigmoid colon and rectum.

label: Gender medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of the biological and physiological differences between males and females and how they effect differences in disease presentation and management.

label: Gynaecology and obstetrics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the health of the female reproductive system, pregnancy and birth.

label: Hepatic and biliary medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the liver, gallbladder, bile ducts and bile.

label: Infectious tropical disease
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the infectious diseases of the tropics.

label: Trauma medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that treats body wounds or shock produced by sudden physical injury, as from violence or accident.

label: Medical toxicology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis, management and prevention of poisoning and other adverse health effects caused by medications, occupational and environmental toxins, and biological agents.

label: Musculoskeletal medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of disorders of the muscle, bone and connective tissue.  It incorporates aspects of orthopaedics, rheumatology, rehabilitation medicine and pain medicine.

label: Opthalmology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with disorders of the eye, including eyelid, optic nerve/visual pathways and occular muscles.

label: Paediatrics
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the medical care of infants, children and adolescents.

label: Psychiatry
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branch of medicine that deals with the mangement of mental illness, emotional disturbance and abnormal behaviour.

label: Reproductive health
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the health of the reproductive processes, functions and systems at all stages of life.

label: Surgery
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the use of operative, manual and instrumental techniques on a patient to investigate and/or treat a pathological condition or help improve bodily function or appearance.

label: Urology and nephrology
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the branches of medicine and physiology focussing on the function and disorders of the urinary system in males and females, the reproductive system in males, and the kidney.

label: Complementary medicine
hasDefinition: Topic concerning medical therapies that fall beyond the scope of conventional medicine but may be used alongside it in the treatment of disease and ill health.

label: MRI
hasDefinition: Topic concerning techniques that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.

label: Neutron diffraction
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the study of matter by studying the diffraction pattern from firing neutrons at a sample, typically to determine atomic and/or magnetic structure.

label: Tomography
hasDefinition: Topic concerning imaging in sections (sectioning), through the use of a wave-generating device (tomograph) that generates an image (a tomogram).

label: Data mining
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the discovery of patterns in large data sets and the extraction and trasnsformation of those patterns into a useful format.

label: Machine learning
hasDefinition: A topic concerning the application of artificial intelligence methods to algorithms, in order to create methods that can learn from data in order to generate an ouput, rather than relying on explicitly encoded information only.

label: Biological databases
hasDefinition: Topic concerning databases of biological information including the results of scientific experiments, the application of high-throughput technology, computational analysis and the the scientific literature.

label: Animals
comment: The resource may be specific to a plant, a group of plants or all plants.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning animals, e.g. information on a specific animal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.

label: Protein sites, features and motifs
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the biologiy, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in protein sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

label: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs
hasDefinition: Topic concerning the biologiy, archival, detection, prediction and analysis of positional features such as functional and other key sites, in nucleic acid sequences and the conserved patterns (motifs, profiles etc.) that may be used to describe them.

label: Gene transcript features
hasDefinition: Topic concerning features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules.
comment: This includes 5'untranslated region (5'UTR), coding sequences (CDS), exons, intervening sequences (intron) and 3'untranslated regions (3'UTR).

label: Protein-ligand interactions
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).

label: Protein-drug interactions
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-drug interaction(s).

label: Genotyping experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning genotype experiment including case control, population, and family studies. These might use array based methods and re-sequencing methods.

label: GWAS study
hasDefinition: Topic concerning genome-wide association study experiments.

label: Microarray experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning microarray experiments including conditions, protocol, sample:data relationships etc.
comment: This might specify which raw data file relates to which sample and information on hybridisations, e.g. which are technical and which are biological replicates.

label: PCR experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning PCR experiments, e.g. quantitative real-time PCR.

label: Proteomics experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning proteomics experiments.

label: 2D PAGE experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning two-dimensional gel electrophoresis experiments, gels or spots in a gel.

label: Northern blot experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning Northern Blot experiments.

label: RNAi experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNAi experiments.

label: Simulation experiment
hasDefinition: Topic concerning biological computational model experiments (simulation), for example the minimum information required in order to permit its correct interpretation and reproduction.

label: Protein-nucleic acid interactions
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-DNA/RNA interaction(s).

label: Protein-protein interactions
hasDefinition: Topic concerning protein-protein interaction(s), including interactions between protein domains.

label: Cellular process pathways
hasDefinition: Topic concernning cellular process pathways.

label: Disease pathways
hasDefinition: Topic concerning disease pathways, typically of human disease.

label: Environmental information processing pathways
hasDefinition: Topic concerning environmental information processing pathways.

label: Genetic information processing pathways
hasDefinition: Topic concerning genetic information processing pathways.

label: Protein super-secondary structure
comment: Super-secondary structures include leucine zippers, coiled coils, Helix-Turn-Helix etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).

label: Protein active sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme.

label: Protein binding sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning ligand-binding (non-catalytic) residues of a protein, such as sites that bind metal, prosthetic groups or lipids.

label: Protein-nucleic acid binding sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites in protein sequences.

label: Protein cleavage sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent) in a protein sequence.

label: Protein chemical modifications
hasDefinition: Topic concerning chemical modification of a protein.

label: Protein disordered structure
hasDefinition: Topic concerning disordered structure in a protein.

label: Protein domains
comment: The report will typically include a graphic of the location of domains in a sequence, with associated data such as lists of related sequences, literature references, etc.
hasDefinition: Topic concerning structural domains or 3D folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.

label: Protein key folding sites
hasDefinition: Topic concerning key residues involved in protein folding.

label: Protein post-translational modifications
hasDefinition: Topic concerning post-translation modifications in a protein sequence, typically describing the specific sites involved.

label: Protein secondary structure
comment: The location and size of the secondary structure elements and intervening loop regions is typically given.  The report can include disulphide bonds and post-translationally formed peptide bonds (crosslinks).
hasDefinition: Topic concerning secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein.

label: Protein sequence repeats
hasDefinition: Topic concerning short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in a protein sequence.

label: Protein signal peptides
hasDefinition: Topic concerning signal peptides or signal peptide cleavage sites in protein sequences.
